title: Improve performance in Power BI by Curbal

value.title: DAX Fridays! #126: Understand the Formula Engine and Storage Engine to optimize your DAX queries
value.excerpt: To be able to optimize DAX queries, you need to know how the formula engine and the storage engine work with them, so how about we let them explain themselves? #curbal #powerbi #dax #DAXFridays  Hope you enjoy the video, i had fun doing it :)  Have you missed the Vertipaq series? Here are the videos:

value.title: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression
value.excerpt: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression Vertipaq is the database and engine that runs on top of Power BI and PowerPivot.   When we import data in Power BI, the Vertipaq database will try with a series of algorithms, to compress the data as much as possible and the best way possible

value.title: Why is Vertipaq so fast? Part 2: Columnar database
value.excerpt: Why is Vertipaq so fast and what does it mean that it is a columnar database? value.title: Why is Vertipaq so fast? Part 3: Segment Elimination
value.excerpt: Why is Vertipaq so fast? Segmenting the data is one of Vertipaq tricks to manage data at blazing fast speeds. In this video, I will explain what that is. value.title: DAX Fridays! #140:Flat tables or models in Power BI? Which one should I choose and why?
value.excerpt: Should you work with flat wide tables or create models in Power BI? In this video, I walk you through the advantages of creating models instead of flattening your tables. #curbal #daxfridays #powerbi  Link to resources mentioned in the video: About Vertipaq: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDz00l_jz6zyfWLZIu8psvTESmKuVDUoG
